data.name: NotSupported
data.value: This functionality is not supported on this operating system.

data.name: NotEnabled
data.value: Could not enable drive {0}.

data.name: InvalidDrive
data.value: The command cannot turn on the restore computer infrastructure on the specified computer because the supplied drive is not valid. Enter a valid drive in the Drive parameter, and then try again.

data.name: NoSystemDrive
data.value: Include System Drive in the list of Drives.

data.name: NotValidDrive
data.value: The command cannot turn off the restore computer infrastructure because the supplied drive is not valid. Enter a valid drive in the Drive parameter, and then try again.

data.name: NotDisabled
data.value: The command cannot disable System Restore on the {0} drive. You may not have sufficient permissions to perform this operation.

data.name: ServiceDisabled
data.value: SystemRestore service is disabled.

data.name: RestorePointNotCreated
data.value: The system restore infrastructure cannot create a restore point.

data.name: RestoreFailed
data.value: The last attempt to restore the computer failed.

data.name: RestoreSuccess
data.value: The computer has been restored to the specified restore point.

data.name: RestoreInterrupted
data.value: The last attempt to restore the computer was interrupted.

data.name: NoRestorePoint
data.value: The command cannot locate the "{0}" restore point. Verify the "{0}" sequence number, and then try the command again.

data.name: RestartcomputerFailed
data.value: Failed to restart the computer {0} with the following error message: {1}.

data.name: OperationFailed
data.value: This command cannot be run on target computer('{1}') due to following error: {0}.{2}

data.name: StopcomputerFailed
data.value: Failed to stop the computer {0} with the following error message: {1}.

data.name: InvalidRestorePoint
data.value: The command cannot restore the computer because "{0}" has not been set as valid restore point. Enter a valid restore point in the RestorePoint parameter, and then try again.

data.name: RestartNeeded
data.value: The changes will take effect after you restart the computer {1}.

data.name: RemoveComputerConfirm
data.value: After you leave the domain, you will need to know the password of the local Administrator account to log onto this computer. Do you wish to continue?

data.name: InvalidComputerNameFormat
data.value: The following computer name is not valid: {0}. Make sure that the computer name is not longer than 255 characters, that it does not contain two or more consecutive dots, that it does not begin with a dot, that it does not contain only numeric characters, and that it does not contain any of the following characters: {{|}}~[\]^:;<=>?@!"#$%^`()+/,

data.name: InvalidDomainNameFormat
data.value: The domain in computer name '{0}' is not valid. Make sure that the domain exists and that the name is a valid domain name.

data.name: ComputerNamesAreEqual
data.value: The value specified for the NewComputerName parameter is the same as the value of the ComputerName parameter. Provide a different value for the NewComputerName parameter.

data.name: ResetComputerMachinePassword
data.value: "The password of the secure channel between '{0}' and '{1}' has been reset."

data.name: SystemRestoreServiceDisabled
data.value: This command cannot be run due to the following error: the service cannot be started because it is disabled or does not have enabled devices associated with it.

data.name: ProgressActivity
data.value: Creating a system restore point ...

data.name: ProgressStatusCreatingRestorePoint
data.value: Creating a system restore point... {0}% Completed.

data.name: ProgressStatusCompleted
data.value: Completed.

data.name: NetworkPathNotFound
data.value: Try below options and Run the command again. 1. Verify that the target computer('{0}') is running. 2. Specify full computer name of the target computer('{0}').

data.name: PrivilegeNotEnabled
data.value: Failed to restart the computer {0}. Access rights {1} cannot be enabled for the calling process.

data.name: RestartComputerAction
data.value: Enable the {0} and restart the computer.

data.name: LocalShutdownPrivilege
data.value: Local shutdown access rights

data.name: RemoteShutdownPrivilege
data.value: Remote shutdown access rights

data.name: CannotWaitLocalComputer
data.value: Cannot wait for the local computer to restart. The local computer is ignored when the Wait parameter is specified.

data.name: RestartComputerInvalidParameter
data.value: The parameters Timeout, For, and Delay are valid only when the parameter Wait is specified.

data.name: RestartMultipleComputersActivity
data.value: Restarting computers...

data.name: RestartSingleComputerActivity
data.value: Restarting computer {0}

data.name: WaitForMultipleComputers
data.value: Completed: {0}/{1}.

data.name: VerifyRebootStage
data.value: Verifying that the computer has been restarted...

data.name: WaitForPowerShell
data.value: Waiting for PowerShell connectivity...

data.name: WaitForRestartToBegin
data.value: Waiting for the restart to begin...

data.name: WaitForWinRM
data.value: Waiting for WinRM connectivity...

data.name: WaitForWMI
data.value: Waiting for WMI connectivity...

data.name: RestartComplete
data.value: Restart is complete

data.name: NoSupportForCombinedServiceType
data.value: The combined service types are not supported for now.

data.name: CannotResolveComputerName
data.value: Computer name {0} cannot be resolved with the exception: {1}.

data.name: IncorrectNewNameNumber
data.value: The number of new names is not equal to the number of target computers.

data.name: InvalidNewName
data.value: Skip computer '{0}' with new name '{1}' because the new name is not valid. The new computer name entered is not properly formatted. Standard names may contain letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and hyphens (-), but no spaces or periods (.). The name may not consist entirely of digits, and may not be longer than 63 characters.

data.name: NewNameIsOldName
data.value: Skip computer '{0}' with new name '{1}' because the new name is the same as the current name.

data.name: ComputerNotInDomain
data.value: Cannot remove computer '{0}' because it is not in a domain.

data.name: FailToJoinWorkGroup
data.value: Failed to join computer '{0}' to workgroup '{1}' with the following error message: {2}

data.name: NetworkDown
data.value: Cannot remove computer(s) from the domain because the local network is down.

data.name: FailToRename
data.value: Fail to rename computer '{0}' to '{1}' due to the following exception: {2}.

data.name: AddComputerActionDomain
data.value: Join in domain '{0}'

data.name: AddComputerActionWorkgroup
data.value: Join in workgroup '{0}'

data.name: AddComputerToSameDomain
data.value: Cannot add computer '{0}' to domain '{1}' because it is already in that domain.

data.name: AddComputerToSameWorkgroup
data.value: Cannot add computer '{0}' to workgroup '{1}' because it is already in that workgroup.

data.name: FailToRenameAfterJoinWorkgroup
data.value: Computer '{0}' successfully joined the workgroup '{1}', but could not be renamed to '{2}' with the following error message: {3}.

data.name: FailToSwitchFromDomainToWorkgroup
data.value: Computer '{0}' was successfully unjoined from the domain '{1}', but it failed to join the workgroup '{2}' with the following error message: {3}.

data.name: FailToUnjoinDomain
data.value: Failed to unjoin computer '{0}' from domain '{1}' with the following error message: {2}.

data.name: FailToConnectToComputer
data.value: Cannot establish the WMI connection to the computer '{0}' with the following error message: {1}.

data.name: FailToJoinDomainFromWorkgroup
data.value: Computer '{0}' failed to join domain '{1}' from its current workgroup '{2}' with following error message: {3}.

data.name: FailToJoinNewDomainAfterUnjoinOldDomain
data.value: Computer '{0}' was successfully unjoined from domain '{1}', but failed to join the new domain '{2}' with the following error message: {3}.

data.name: FailToRenameAfterJoinDomain
data.value: Computer '{0}' was successfully joined to the new domain '{1}', but renaming it to '{2}' failed with the following error message: {3}.

data.name: InvalidJoinOptions
data.value: The flag '{0}' is valid only if flag '{1}' is specified.

data.name: CannotRenameMultipleComputers
data.value: Cannot rename multiple computers. The NewName parameter is valid only if a single computer is specified.

data.name: CannotFindMachineAccountFromDomain
data.value: Cannot find the computer account for the local computer in the domain {0}.

data.name: CannotFindMachineAccountFromServer
data.value: Cannot find the computer account for the local computer from the domain controller {0}.

data.name: FailToGetDomainInformation
data.value: Cannot get domain information about the local computer because of the following exception: {0}.

data.name: FailToResetPasswordOnDomain
data.value: Cannot reset the secure channel password for the computer account in the domain. Operation failed with the following exception: {0}.

data.name: FailToResetPasswordOnLocalMachine
data.value: Resetting the secure channel password for the local computer failed with the following error message: {0}.

data.name: NeedAdminPrivilegeToResetPassword
data.value: Administrator rights are required to reset the secure channel password on the local computer. Access is denied.

data.name: ResetComputerNotInDomain
data.value: Cannot reset the secure channel password for the account of the local computer. The local computer is not currently part of a domain.

data.name: TruncateNetBIOSName
data.value: The NetBIOS name of the computer is limited to 15 bytes, which is 15 characters in this case. The NetBIOS name will be shortened to "{0}", which may cause conflicts under NetBIOS name resolution. Do you wish to continue?

data.name: TruncateNetBIOSNameCaption
data.value: NetBIOS name will be truncated.

data.name: CannotResolveServerName
data.value: The specified server name {0} cannot be resolved.

data.name: CannotCreateRestorePointWarning
data.value: A new system restore point cannot be created because one has already been created within the past {0} minutes. The frequency of restore point creation can be changed by creating the DWORD value 'SystemRestorePointCreationFrequency' under the registry key 'HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\SystemRestore'. The value of this registry key indicates the necessary time interval (in minutes) between two restore point creation. The default value is 1440 minutes (24 hours).

data.name: CannotGetOperatingSystemObject
data.value: The Win32_OperatingSystem WMI object cannot be retrieved.

data.name: RestartComputerSkipped
data.value: The computer {0} is skipped. Fail to retrieve its LastBootUpTime via the WMI service with the following error message: {1}.

data.name: FailToTestSecureChannel
data.value: Cannot verify the secure channel for the local computer. Operation failed with the following exception: {0}.

data.name: RepairSecureChannelFail
data.value: The attempt to repair the secure channel between the local computer and the domain {0} has failed.

data.name: RepairSecureChannelSucceed
data.value: The secure channel between the local computer and the domain {0} was successfully repaired.

data.name: SecureChannelAlive
data.value: The secure channel between the local computer and the domain {0} is in good condition.

data.name: SecureChannelBroken
data.value: The secure channel between the local computer and the domain {0} is broken.

data.name: TestComputerNotInDomain
data.value: Cannot verify the secure channel password for the local computer. The local computer is not currently part of a domain.

data.name: SystemRestoreNotSupported
data.value: The operation cannot be performed because the system restore APIs are not supported on the Advanced RISC Machine (ARM) platform.

data.name: TimeoutError
data.value: The computer did not finish restarting within the specified time-out period.

data.name: FailToRetrieveLastRestorePoint
data.value: Cannot validate the time interval for restore point creation. It failed to retrieve the last restore point with the following error message: {0}.

data.name: InvalidParameterSetAsJob
data.value: The AsJob Parameter Set is not supported.

data.name: InvalidParameterForCoreClr
data.value: The {0} parameter is not supported for CoreCLR.

data.name: ShutdownCommandNotFound
data.value: The required native command 'shutdown' was not found.
